definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: They passed the dry bed of a rivulet.
sentences.chinese: 他们跨过了一道干涸的河床。

sentences.english: Rivers and lakes might dry up in some places, and glaciers might melt.
sentences.chinese: 某些地方的河川跟湖泊可能干涸，冰河也可能溶化。

sentences.english: Although their juices had run dry, the leaves still exuded a pleasant aroma.
sentences.chinese: 只管已干涸，落叶仍披发出好闻的喷香味。

sentences.english: The dry river- bed find no thanks for its past.
sentences.chinese: 干涸的河床不对它的过往心存任何感激。

sentences.english: Rain of the bosom flowers fall into the dry land of my admiring heart.
sentences.chinese: 盛开的花雨落在我充满渴望的心那干涸的土地上。

sentences.english: Once the bauxite is gone, they fear, the streams will run dry.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心一旦铝土不在了，溪流将会干涸。

sentences.english: The spring dried up long ago.
The agronomist suggested growing rice on the dried river bed.
sentences.chinese: 农学家建议在干涸的河床上种水稻。

sentences.english: The small brook nearly dried up.
sentences.chinese: 这条小河沟几乎干涸了。

sentences.english: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and dried up.
sentences.chinese: 海中的水必绝尽，河也消没干涸。

sentences.english: The long drought dried up all the wells.
sentences.chinese: 长期的干旱使所有的井都干涸了。

sentences.english: The latest satellite data shows a dried-up Huai River.
sentences.chinese: 最新的卫星数据显示，淮河已经干涸。

sentences.english: Think of dry northwest of China, please save water.
sentences.chinese: 想想我们干涸的大西北，请珍惜每一滴水。

sentences.english: The never-failing brook, the busy mill.
sentences.chinese: 永不干涸的溪流，繁忙的磨坊。

sentences.english: I turned my head and saw a small crucian carp in the dried-up carriage ditch.
sentences.chinese: 我回过头来，看见干涸的车沟里有条小螂鱼。

sentences.english: The long drought dried up all the wells in the village.
sentences.chinese: 久旱使村中所有的水井都干涸了。

definition: to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
(of dry soil, skin etc) to crack/to chap
